message:
Hi Stephen,
Is it possible to not await an async method to make it fire and forget kind of implementation?  

My application is built on ASP.Net Core 2.1 as of today. And I am looking to hand off few processing (some metric logging) in background (not critical). At the same time, I also do not want to block the response from being sent to the caller just for awaiting on these logging.

Hence the question, whether it is possible to just skip the await for such processing? Any suggestion would be helpful?
